metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10739 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> glibc uses this internally to parse config files, fixing this may introduce unwanted regressions and changes in behaviour leosilva> See CVE-2019-18348 for Python that is affected by this issue.

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'change too intrusive').
